Official Rules

Chris Jones for Congress • AR-02 #PrimaryVote! Scavenger Hunt

Contest: Feb 13 – Mar 3, 2026 Deadline: Mar 3 • 5:00 PM Teams: 2 people (buddy system)

1) Mission

Flood social media with daily, creative vertical video that helps voters understand the upcoming primary + nonpartisan election, early voting, and where to vote — then tag the campaign so we can repost and amplify.

2) Team Structure & Eligibility

  • Teams must be two people (buddy system required when traveling).
  • Teams must register on the contest site and complete a team profile.
  • Only submissions logged on your Team Profile Page will be reviewed or scored.

3) Universal Hashtag Rule (Applies to EVERYTHING)

Required hashtags on every video:

  • #PrimaryVote! (required gate)
  • #ChrisJonesforCongress (required)

If either hashtag is missing, the submission earns 0 points. No partial credit. No exceptions.

Hashtag bonus points (only if eligible): +1 for #PrimaryVote! and +1 for #ChrisJonesforCongress.

4) Core Scoring Categories

A) Polling Location Explainer (Vertical, 30–60 seconds)

Score is based only on the checklist items the team claims and the campaign verifies.

Checklist items (5):

  1. Address of the polling location
  2. Where it is geographically (near what / cross streets / neighborhood)
  3. Early voting timeline (Feb 17 – Mar 3)
  4. Primary + nonpartisan election explanation
  5. Say: “Vote for Chris Jones for Congress”

Base points per checklist item:

  • Little Rock polling locations: 2 points per item (max 10)
  • City limits of Searcy, Conway, Bryant, Benton, Sherwood, Jacksonville, Maumelle: 3 points per item (max 15)
  • All other locations: 4 points per item (max 20)

B) “Why I Support Chris Jones”

  • Up to 2 videos per team
  • 25 points each (max 50)
  • Must include required hashtags or earns 0

C) Campaign-Sanctioned Volunteer Events (Live While Volunteering)

  • 5 points per event
  • Must have signed up in advance via Mobilize or official campaign communication
  • Must post a live video while volunteering
  • Must include required hashtags or earns 0

5) Bonus Points

Cross-Post Platform Bonus

You may submit to the social platform(s) of your choice: TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, X (Twitter), or Bluesky.

Bonus: +5 points for each additional platform you cross-post on for the same content. (Example: you post the same video to TikTok + Instagram + Facebook = +10 bonus.)

8-County Sweep Bonus

+50 points one time when a team has at least one approved polling-location video in each county:

Pulaski, Faulkner, Saline, White, Cleburne, Perry, Conway, Van Buren

Posting Streak Bonuses (Must Submit for Bonus)

  • 3-day streak: +10
  • 5-day streak: +25
  • 7-day streak: +40
  • 10-day streak: +60

Streaks are based on submission dates (not approval dates) and only count if later approved.

New Team Recruit Bonus

+20 points per recruit when all requirements are met:

  1. Celebratory video with recruit on camera
  2. Required hashtags included
  3. Recruit signs up via the official volunteer signup link
  4. Recruit creates/joins a team on the contest site

Candidate Interview Bonus

+5 points for interviewing a candidate on the ballot (hashtags required).

Distance & Coverage Bonus (Limited)

Distance/coverage bonus applies only for polling locations outside a team’s home county AND not within the major city categories (Little Rock, Searcy, Conway, Bryant, Benton, Sherwood, Jacksonville, Maumelle).

6) Submission & Verification (No Confusion Policy)

What teams must do

  1. Post the video publicly
  2. Include required hashtags
  3. Tag the campaign
  4. Go to Team Profile → Submit a Video
  5. Paste link(s), choose type, check claimed items, and list expected points (including any cross-post bonus)

How the campaign scores

  • We verify hashtags first.
  • We verify only what the team claimed.
  • We do not look for ways to give points.
  • If the team didn’t list it, the team doesn’t receive those points.

7) Leaderboards

  • Landing page shows Top 5 teams.
  • Leaderboard page shows ALL teams and scores.

8) Disqualifiers / Zero-Point Submissions

  • Missing either required hashtag
  • Not submitted through the team profile
  • Private/broken/unverifiable link
  • Late submission (after 5:00 PM on Mar 3)
  • Claimed items not actually present
